items.content_html:
What & Why

Cryptocurrencies have been trending in 2017 and in 2021 due to their opportunity to revolutionize traditional finance. Most notably, Bitcoin grew in popularity, gaining over 10000% to up to $69,000 per coin, raising the question of whether it can successfully lead the future of finance and serve as a digital alternative to Gold.

Questions

  • Could crypto replace traditional finance?
  • Can Bitcoin survive in the long term?
  • Can Bitcoin grow to more than 10% of Gold’s market capitalization?
  • Can crypto survive regulatory pressure?
  • What would the world look like with everyone using crypto?
  • What drove the previous bull runs? What might cause the next ones?
  • Does Bitcoin serve as a good inflation hedge?
  • What is the risk of black swan events?

Data

  • Crypto Trends

  • Unique BTC addresses 
  • Exchange BTC traded volume 
  • Confirmed BTC transactions 
  • Active ETH addresses 
  • Daily ETH transactions 

Risks

  • Satoshi selling their stake of 1 million Bitcoins
  • Bitcoin being exposed as US government experiment, making RU/CN more suspicious of it
  • Extremely harsh regulations (consumer protection, environment, securities laws)
  • Competition with government-issued digital currencies
  • Tighter controls around Internet access
  • Quantum computing cracking SHA256
  • Network attacks and mining centralization
  • Anti-Proof of Work regulations
  • Harsh securities laws applied to most crypto tokens
  • Statistically likely that underlying tech fails or becomes exploited
  • Not enough demand for “digital gold”
  • Not enough performance to compete with centralized payment systems (CBDC)
  • No narratives to drive subsequent bull runs

Optimistic Predictions

  • Crypto & DeFi operate alongside central bank currencies successfully
  • CBDCs handle the payment layer, while DeFi/crypto handles all layer-2 applications
  • Bitcoin is successfully maintained, despite all security risks, enabling it to survive for the foreseeable future
  • Bitcoin gains acceptance as digital Gold and adoption grows for individuals, companies, governments
  • Bitcoin is just at the beginning of an S-curve adoption, with early adopters using the technology exclusively so far (we will see a massive adoption over the next 20-30 years)
  • Adoption will be driven by India, Asia, Latin America, and Africa, where most users just come online and have yet to discover the power of frictionless payments
  • Bitcoin will become easy-to-use, extremely fast with cheap fees through a layer-2 solution like the lightning network
  • Bitcoin will be denominated in sats, increasing the perception of owning “cheaper” Bitcoin
  • Crypto will build upon its strong values (trustlessness, anti-censorship, decentralization), out-competing CBDCs, which are trying to regulate, control, and censor their users

Pessimistic Predictions

  • Crypto struggles to gain adoption as central bank digital currencies push it out of the market
  • Crypto will become too regulated in regards to privacy, access (only professional investors), environmental laws, securities laws
  • A black-swan event (see risks) destroys all confidence in the early cryptocurrencies
  • End-users don’t care about decentralization
  • Original cryptos (Bitcoin etc.) persist in their use as storage of value while losing their use as a payment layer
  • Original cryptos (Bitcoin etc.) persist in their use as a payment layer while losing their use as storage of value
  • Bitcoin will not reach an S-curve adoption as expected (as compared to Internet or mobile phone adoption) due to a lack of use-case

  • Bitcoin user adoption report

items.title: The "OG Token" Hypothesis

items.content_html:
In each crypto cycle, new narratives begin to drive and lead the bull market. In 2017, ICOs, mining, masternodes, Chinese market tokens (NEO, Qtum, Vechain), unique L1s (DAGs such as Iota/Raiblocks), and Bitcoin as “digital gold” were the main narratives for the bull market.

The 2021/2022 cycle began with DeFi and quickly turned into an incredible run for NFTs, metaverse, lending, staking, and yield farming narratives. Most notably, the 2021/2022 bull run was driven by meme tokens (promotion of Dogecoin by Elon) and the emergence of Binance Smart Chain (Safemoon), letting anyone launch tokens based on hype (shilled to financially uneducated Gen-Z on TikTok and Instagram).

This leads us to the question of whether we can predict the narrative that will drive the next bull market or even grow uncorrelated to Bitcoin. From all our bets, we want to share one big hypothesis for the coming bull market, betting on potentially upcoming regulations: stronger asset security laws, ESG, environment, cannabis, and payments with strong usability (CBDC alternatives).

In both the 2017 bull market and the 2021/2022 bull market, many people lost money by investing in ICOs/tokens that are nothing but unregistered securities. These tokens will likely be regulated out of the market or sold to zero by continuous sell pressure from founders/early investors.

We believe that coins definitively passing the Howey test will be considered valuable (again), especially tokens that have passed the test of time with an organic distribution (=no presale). We call this the OG Token Hypothesis.

What are these particular OG tokens? Tokens that were launched 8-10 years ago without a presale and distributed via mining or staking. Candidates include Dogecoin, Namecoin, Peercoin, Feathercoin, Vertcoin, Reddcoin, Nxt, Navcoin, Blackcoin, Hempcoin, Potcoin, and similar. These have a rich history, some even very active development, and mature communities.

Why OG Tokens?

Let’s look at some arguments which might contribute to possible narratives around these “OG tokens.”

- Blockchains operating since 2012/2013 - some of the oldest blockchains after Bitcoin
- Owning part of crypto history as a fungible token (with better liquidity than NFTs)
- Unlikely classified as security! (Any security regulation will be favorable for these tokens)
- Were top 10 once (brand value), crypto OGs know Peercoin, Namecoin, Feathercoin, etc.
- Peercoin as the first-proof-of-stake coin, Namecoin as the first blockchain focused on identity & asset registry.
- Peercoin & Namecoin at ~15m market cap, Navcoin at ~3m market cap, - Feathercoin at ~2m market cap (compared to Litecoin, Dogecoin at a multi-billion dollar market cap)
- Passing the test of time with 8-10 years of history
- Active development (Peercoin, Vertcoin, Blackcoin, Navcoin)
- Potential listings on large exchanges if interest grows again
- Potential narratives around first-proof-of-stake, ESG, and environment/green tokens (Peercoin) - especially if Washington and - - Brussels decide to penalize PoW mining
- Potential narratives around cannabis legalization (Hempcoin, Potcoin)- Hash-rate is slowly growing (with a recent boost by ETH switching to PoS)
- Potential narratives around privacy-oriented blockchains (Navcoin)
- Largely governed by the community (with oversight by foundations, for example the Peercoin Foundation, which publishes yearly financial reports
- Highly distributed Peercoin has 53,639 addresses, Namecoin has 52,146 addresses, Navcoin has 25,065 addresses, Blackcoin 19,336 addresses, Feathercoin has 12,579 addresses

Risks and Concerns

Our biggest concern is the lack of liquidity for these tokens (which will also cause a massive supply shortage in case the proposed narrative starts gaining traction). Many of these tokens are listed only on Bittrex or exchanges that are old and not used by recent crypto entrants. Larger exchanges don’t want to deal with the maintenance of small market cap blockchains. This isn’t likely to change unless the market demands it, as was the case with Dogecoin.

Prices

Let us create a paper portfolio of some low market cap picks and track them over a few years relative to BTC. We believe the risk/reward is incredibly high, likely above 10:1 for a multi-year holding period. We also acknowledge that some of our picks (statistically, as history shows) might experience hacks or dump to zero over a long enough horizon. Regardless, we think the tokens that make it will compensate for the losses.

Sample portfolio, with prices as of Oct 6th 2022. 
Peercoin - $0.55
Namecoin - $1.10
Navcoin - $0.046
Feathercoin - $0.0077
Blackcoin - $0.015
Hempcoin - $0.0027
Potcoin - $0.0032
